intro: Cannaeorchis fractiflexa, commonly known as the flexible orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and intricate petal arrangement. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its flowers are usually small and delicate, displaying a range of colors from pale pink to deep violet. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cannaeorchis fractiflexa is considered a rare and endangered species.
